programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We’re in the small town of Bethlehem for the Maluti Motor show. Francisco is in Johannesburg finding out how one collection turned into a fleet of vehicles.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: There's fun, speed and challenges at the Festival of Motoring. What's the best way to kart, indoors or outdoors? A tuned BMW 330d is the latest Drag Kings hopeful. We swop horsepower for human power in the annual Bed Race and we showcase a Subaru WRX that's been tuned to the max.

programme.title: Lancia Delta S4
programme.desc: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, or so the saying goes. Technically the Delta S4 is the most lavishly designed race car. The S4 developed by Aurelio Lampredi and Claudio Lombardi is entered in 1986 as a successor to the Lancia Rally 037 in the Group B.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: The 2024 season of the European Truck Racing Championship kicks off in Misano, Italy, with new tyres and two new driver categories.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: The teams and drivers head to the south-western part of Slovakia in order to prove their expertise near Bratislava at the Automotodróm Slovakia Ring.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: It's off to Belgium for Round 3 of the 2024 European Truck Racing Championship at the circuit of Zolder.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: The fourth round of the ETRC's 2024 season is the International ADAC Truck Grand Prix at the Nürburgring.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: The Autodrom Most in the Czech Republic hosts Round 5 of the 2024 season of the European Truck Racing Championship.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: For the sixth round of the 2024 season of the ETRC, the teams and drivers gather in Le Mans, France.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: The Circuito del Jarama in Spain is the location of Round 7 of the 2024 season of this exciting truck racing competition.

programme.title: Toyota GT86 J-Sport
programme.desc: With the Toyota GT 86 from J-Sport, it is noticeable that the company's roots lie in racing. The fans' wish to give the Japanese racer significantly more power nevertheless remained unfulfilled.

programme.title: Jaguar XJR
programme.desc: The highlight of the XJR lies beneath the hood: all of Jaguar's top models are equipped with the 5-liter V8 compressor engine that delivers 550 HP in this sports sedan.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: What are the characteristics of a typical German car? Do stereotypes like functionality, reliability but also a certain dullness paint a realistic picture? Also, we explored if the Volkswagen Golf GTE could bring new impulses to the brand's model range.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Slippery or muddy roads and bad visibility are circumstances that often spoil driving pleasure in winter. We took two almost identical Porsche 911's to an icy test track. Also: drifting fun in the snow with the Suzuki SX4 S-Cross.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: 4-door coupes combine the best of two worlds, the performance of a coupe and the style of a limousine. We took a closer look at three examples of this car subspecies, the Audi A7, BMW's 4 Series Gran Coupe, and the Mercedes-Benz CLA models.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: The top-of-the-line specimens of a car model range are built for pure driving pleasure. We put the VW Golf R, the Audi TTS and the BMW M 235i to the test in order to see if they are worthy of bearing the crown of their model range.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: In 2015 Audi presented a facelift for their city racer A1. We put this compact to the test. Also: it's a tough competition in the compact class, and Renault and Peugeot also want a piece of the pie. We compared the Renault Twingo and the Peugeot 108.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The G-Power M5 Hurricane RS Touring is one of the fastest station wagons in the world. Also: the Artega GT. And: the Austin FX4.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The company Mechatronik is dedicated to the restoration and refinement of Mercedes-Benz classics. Also: the Nissan 370 Z takes on Porsche Cayman & Co. And: the Chevrolet Camaro and the Mercedes-AMG ML 63.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The MF5 GT, the powerhouse from Wiesmann. What's more: if you're looking for exclusivity and find even the performance of a Mercedes-AMG too low, you've come to the right place. The Brabus company is one of the most famous tuners in the world.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The International Motor Show in Geneva is the first important vehicle fair of the year. Of course, the top class refiners must not be missing. Also: the Mercedes-AMG SL 63. The sixth generation of the SL is more powerful than ever before.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The tuning forge MTM is known for its extremely dynamic, optimally tuned vehicles. What's more: the Nissan Juke-R is a projectile with the dimensions of a cigar box and 485 hp of power.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Lancia Stratos HF
programme.desc: The Lancia Stratos with Ferrari power, the rally icon of the 1970s.

programme.title: Ken Block - Gymkhana Grid
programme.desc: Spectacular drifts are to be expected when Ken Block visits the Gymkhana Grid.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: We took the Mercedes AMG SLS GT to an airfield and the Porsche 911 Turbo S to the racetrack in order to see these sporty driving machines in action and test their performance. In addition: the Audi R8 4.0 TFSI's innovative lighting technology.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Jaguar found their way back to the world of sports cars. The F-Type doesn't just look good, it's got what it takes, and the car is able to take on the competition like the BMW Z4. We also took a closer look at two other competitors, the Porsche Boxster S and Nissan's 370 Z.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: For more than 60 years the Corvette has been the embodiment of the American sports car. Also: the Ford Mustang GT, an iconic model with a V8 engine at the price of a Volkswagen Passat. And: the Chevrolet Camaro, another classic from the land where cylinder capacity is still valued a lot.

programme.title: Lamborghini Huracan by O.CT
programme.desc: A lot of power thanks to a compressor. This optimized O.CT Lamborghini Huracán delivers over 800 horse power to get the blood flowing.

programme.title: Morgan ARP4
programme.desc: Since 1950, the exhilarating Morgan +4 has been the mainstay of Morgan production. The ARP4 is the latest addition to the +4 family and strictly limited to a run of 50.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: At the old-timer grand prix at the Nürburgring you for example can see the Mercedes S with 160 horsepower that lead Rudolf Caracciola to victory in the 1927 opening race.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: In this episode we focused on Phoenix Racing, the successful team from the Eifel Region that rocked the DTM.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: At the Nürburgring Patrick chased a 12-cylinder Aston Martin Zagato down the track. Also on the show: a Hummer, a Renault Clio and a Frenchman in a Ferrari.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Visitors from all over the world make their way to the Green Hell of the Nürburgring each year, including many Germans, Austrians and 5 crazy Englishmen in a taxi.

programme.title: Ken Block at the Monza Rallye Show
programme.desc: In Monza, Ken Block is set to compete against Allstars from motorsport at the Monza Rally Show.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: In the US, SUVs aren't usually considered just workhorses but rather treated as everyday vehicles. Americans don't want to miss out on space, comfort and loading capacity. We show you the Chevrolet Suburban, Jeep Cherokee and GMC Yukon.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: SUVs usually are rather impressive right out of the factory, but there are many tuning and customizing options. In this episode we present Kelleners BMW X5, the Mercedes Brabus B63 and the Porsche Cayenne tuned by Techart.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: When the Audi A1 becomes the S1 and the Golf gets an R in its name, these small cars turn into all-wheel beasts. Also: the Mini Countryman gets a rejuvenation. And: a test drive with the best-selling Volvo XC60.

programme.title: Isle of Man - Tourist Trophy, Part 1
programme.desc: Tourist Trophy on the Isle of Man. The abbreviation "TT" could also stand for death and the devil. Every year the most dangerous motorcycle race in the world takes place. One lap in the Tourist Trophy is 61 kilometers long. 260 curves require everything from the riders. It's a unique myth.

programme.title: Isle of Man - Tourist Trophy, Part 2
programme.desc: The most dangerous motorcycle race in the world on the Isle of Man. Marshals at the TT are responsible for the highest possible levels of safety.

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.sub-title: Across Utah on a Harley, Part 1
programme.desc: Utah, land of red rocks, how it was called by the Native Americans. We are on a motorbike tour driving for 1,500 miles through some of the most beautiful and dramatic landscapes in the US. Part 1

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.sub-title: Across Utah on a Harley, Part 2
programme.desc: Utah, land of red rocks, how it was called by the Native Americans. We are on a motorbike tour driving for 1,500 miles through some of the most beautiful and dramatic landscapes in the US. Part 2

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.sub-title: Across Utah on a Harley, Part 3
programme.desc: Utah, land of red rocks, how it was called by the Native Americans. We are on a motorbike tour driving for 1,500 miles through some of the most beautiful and dramatic landscapes in the US. Part 3

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.sub-title: Across Utah on a Harley, Part 4
programme.desc: Utah, land of red rocks, how it was called by the Native Americans. We are on a motorbike tour driving for 1,500 miles through some of the most beautiful and dramatic landscapes in the US. Part 4

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: In 2011, the European Boss Hoss Rally took place in the Pullman City western town in Germany. We show the highlights of this event where nearly 160 V8 monster bikes were gathered. (Part 1 of 2)

programme.title: KTM 990 Adventure
programme.desc: It's very big and mostly comes in orange: the KTM 990 Adventure. Over rough terrain it's often driven standing up. Today, the 990 is considered the off-road specialist among travel Enduros.

programme.title: Kymco People GT 300i
programme.desc: 10 or 16 inch wheels - is this really just a question of taste? Motorvision reveals the advantages and disadvantages of the big wheel motorcycle People GT 300i, made by Kymco.

programme.title: Saab 93 and Saab 99 Turbo
programme.desc: In 1937 an airplane manufacturing company was founded in Sweden that later became the famous car manufacturer Saab. We present two of their iconic car models, the Saab 93 and 99 Turbo.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Jaguar E-Type is a century-old sports car whose look still quickens the pulse today. Those responsible at Jaguar waited almost 40 years before they dared to build a successor to one of the most beautiful cars in the world.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The early history of sports car manufacturer Lamborghini was shaped by the rivalry between tractor manufacturer Ferruccio Lamborghini and Enzo Ferrari. Over the years, the brand launched some of the most striking sports cars in the world.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The 1960s and 1970s were golden years for Opel. Ascona, Manta, Rekord and GT, an Opel was more than just a car, and the company built one classic after another. Today, these car models are all icons.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Since the 1950s, the Mercedes-Benz S-Class has set the standard in the luxury class. The status model of the rich, famous and powerful prevails against crises, social change and all competitors.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The BMW 3 Series is the epitome of a sports saloon. Since its debut in 1975, it has been the undisputed leader of the premium segment. It's a family saloon, a sports car, a tuning object and a racing car.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: We took the Mercedes AMG SLS GT to an airfield and the Porsche 911 Turbo S to the racetrack in order to see these sporty driving machines in action and test their performance. In addition: the Audi R8 4.0 TFSI's innovative lighting technology.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Jaguar found their way back to the world of sports cars. The F-Type doesn't just look good, it's got what it takes, and the car is able to take on the competition like the BMW Z4. We also took a closer look at two other competitors, the Porsche Boxster S and Nissan's 370 Z.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: For more than 60 years the Corvette has been the embodiment of the American sports car. Also: the Ford Mustang GT, an iconic model with a V8 engine at the price of a Volkswagen Passat. And: the Chevrolet Camaro, another classic from the land where cylinder capacity is still valued a lot.
